text.headline:
History of Machine Learning
1950- Present
text.text: This are some of the achievements and discovery of Machine Learning throughout the years..

text.headline: The Turing Test
text.text: Alan Turing introduced Turing Test, a test used to evaluate machines ability to mimic/imitate human behavior. This suggested that machine could also learn human behavior influencing future ML researches.

text.headline: Computer Checkers
text.text: Arthur Samuel made a computer-based checkers program designed to learn automatically from past games and experience. This development marks the first practical use of ML in gaming.

text.headline: The Perceptron
text.text: Frank Rosenblatt introduced the Perceptron, the first neural network that simulates the thought process of the human brain. This single-layer neural network model is capable of recognizing patterns.

text.headline: Nearest Neighbor Algorithm
text.text: The Nearest Neighbor Algorithm started basic pattern recognition. This algorithm allowed computers to classify data points based on their distance to other points in a given dataset.

text.headline: The Backpropagation Algorithm
text.text: This algorithm was a turning point for neural networks. It used a multi-layer network to learn by correcting errors through feedback loops.

text.headline: The Stanford Cart
text.text: The Stanford Cart was a groundbreaking project in autonomous vehicles. Using ML algorithms, the cart automatically navigated obstacles in its environment without human intervention.

text.headline: Deep Blue Defeats Man in Chess
text.text: Deep Blue defeated Garry Kasparov in chess. This proved that a machine can compete against humans in terms of intelligence.

text.headline: DeepFace
text.text: Facebook introduced DeepFace, a facial recognition project using deep learning to identify faces with high accuracy, showcasing ML’s potential for advancing computer vision.

text.headline: Generative AI (Gen AI)
text.text: With the rise of Generative AI models such as GPT, these models generate text, images, videos, and music based on user input.
